{{Relevant guide|Java Edition guides/Mounts of Mayhem|Bedrock Edition guides/Mounts of Mayhem}}
'''Mounts of Mayhem''' is a [[game drop]] that was released on December 9, 2025<ref name="mcnet-image">{{mcnet|mounts-of-mayhem-official-release-date|Mounts of Mayhem official release date|November 26, 2025|Sophie Austin}}</ref> as [[Java Edition 1.21.11]] and [[Bedrock Edition 1.21.130]].  Its theme is "mounts and combat". It introduces the [[spear]]s, [[netherite horse armor]], [[nautilus]]es, [[nautilus armor]], [[zombie horse]]s spawning naturally as zombie horsemen, [[zombie nautilus]]es, [[camel husk]]s, and [[parched]]. It was announced at [[Minecraft LIVE – September 2025]].

== Additions ==
=== Items ===
'''{{InvSprite|Copper Nautilus Armor}} {{InvSprite|Iron Nautilus Armor}} {{InvSprite|Golden Nautilus Armor}} {{InvSprite|Diamond Nautilus Armor}} {{InvSprite|Netherite Nautilus Armor}} [[Nautilus armor]]'''
* A new [[Armor materials|tiered]] [[armor]] type for equipping a tamed [[nautilus]] or [[zombie nautilus]].
* Cannot be crafted. 
* Copper, iron, gold, and diamond variants can be found in ocean structure chests.
* Netherite variant can be obtained by upgrading the diamond variant in a [[smithing table]].

'''{{InvSprite|Netherite Horse Armor}} [[Netherite horse armor]]'''
* A new type of [[horse armor]].
* Provides {{armor|19}} [[armor point]]s, 3 [[armor toughness]], and 1 [[knockback resistance]].
* Obtained by upgrading diamond horse armor using a [[smithing table]] with a [[netherite upgrade]] template.

'''{{InvSprite|Camel Husk Spawn Egg}} {{InvSprite|Nautilus Spawn Egg}} {{InvSprite|Parched Spawn Egg}} {{InvSprite|Zombie Nautilus Spawn Egg}} [[Spawn egg]]s'''
* Added spawn eggs for [[camel husk]]s, [[nautilus]]es, [[parched]], and [[zombie nautilus]]es.

'''{{InvSprite|Wooden Spear}} {{InvSprite|Stone Spear}} {{InvSprite|Copper Spear}} {{InvSprite|Iron Spear}} {{InvSprite|Golden Spear}} {{InvSprite|Diamond Spear}} {{InvSprite|Netherite Spear}} [[Spear]]'''
* A new [[tiered]] weapon.
* Has a longer [[attack range]] than the [[sword]] or any other weapon.
* Includes two main attacks: jab and charge.
* The faster the [[player]] moves while charging, the more [[damage]] is done to an [[entity]].
* Can be crafted using 2 [[stick]]s and its corresponding tier [[item]] or by upgrading from diamond to netherite using a [[smithing table]].

=== Mobs ===
[[File:Camel Husk Idle JE1.gif|60px]] '''[[Camel husk]]'''
* An uncommon [[undead]] variant of the regular [[camel]].
* Spawns in [[desert]]s at night.
** Spawns with two riders: a [[husk]] wielding an [[iron spear]] and a [[parched]], forming a [[camel husk jockey]].
*** The husk rider has a chance to drop a [[rabbit's foot]].
* Counts as a [[hostile mob]] until [[ridden]] by a player, despawning like other hostile mobs.
* Does not burn in [[sunlight]].
* Behaves similarly to a regular camel, except it cannot be bred.
* Can be tempted and healed using a [[rabbit's foot]].
* Drops [[rotten flesh]] like any other [[Zombie (disambiguation)|zombie]]-type mob.

'''[[File:Nautilus Breathe JE1 BE2.gif|50px]] [[Nautilus]]'''
* An [[aquatic]] [[neutral]] [[mount]] that spawns in [[ocean]]s.
* Can dash attack at any mob if provoked.
** Occasionally attacks [[pufferfish]].
* Can be tamed and bred with [[pufferfish (item)|pufferfish]] and [[buckets of pufferfish]], though it can be fed any type of [[fish]] or [[fish bucket]] afterward.
** [[File:Baby Nautilus Breathe JE1.gif|40px]] Baby nautiluses have a unique model and sounds.
* Rideable with a [[saddle]], controlled with mouse/joystick movements, similar to the [[happy ghast]].
* Has a dash movement that can be used while riding it, similar to the [[camel]].
* When ridden, the rider is given the [[Breath of the Nautilus]] effect, freezing their [[oxygen bar]].
* When on land, the nautilus becomes dehydrated.
* Rarely drops a [[nautilus shell]] when killed.

'''[[File:Parched JE2.png|20px]] [[Parched]]'''
* A variant of the [[skeleton]].
* Spawns in [[desert]]s at night.
* Does not burn in sunlight, similarly to the [[husk]].
* Shoots [[arrows of Weakness]].
* Has a slower rate of fire compared to a normal skeleton, similar to the [[bogged]].
* Immune to [[Weakness]].

'''[[File:Zombie Nautilus Breathe JE1 BE2.gif|50px]] [[Zombie nautilus]]'''
* A rare [[undead]] variant of the regular [[nautilus]].
** [[File:Coral Zombie Nautilus Breathe JE1 BE1.gif|50px]] Can also spawn as a coral variant in a [[warm ocean]].
* Spawns being ridden by a [[drowned]] wielding a [[trident]], forming a [[zombie nautilus jockey]].
* Counts as a hostile mob while untamed, despawning like other hostile mobs.
* Behaves similarly to a regular nautilus, except it cannot be bred.
* Swims ~10% faster than regular nautiluses when swimming.
* Doesn't dehydrate when on land.
* Burns in sunlight.
** Nautilus armor prevents the zombie nautilus from burning in sunlight.
* Drops [[rotten flesh]] like any other zombie-type mob.

=== Enchantments ===
'''[[File:Enchanted Book.gif|x32px|class=pixel-image]] [[Lunge]]'''
* [[Spear]] exclusive enchantment with 3 levels.
* Only works with the jab attack.
** When doing a jab attack with Lunge, it propels the player horizontally in the view direction.
* The view angle needs to be perfectly leveled horizontally to achieve maximum lunge distance.
* Consumes [[saturation]] and hunger points at an amount dependent on the enchantment level, as well as 1 durability point.
** Can only be used if the player has 6 or more [[hunger]] points.

=== Effects ===
'''[[File:Breath of the Nautilus.png|32px|class=pixel-image]] [[Breath of the Nautilus]]'''
* Freezes the entity's [[oxygen bar]].
* Applied when riding on a [[nautilus]] or [[zombie nautilus]].

== Changes ==
=== Items ===
'''[[File:Leather Horse Armor JE2.png|32px]] [[File:Leather Horse Armor (item) BE3.png|32px]] [[Leather horse armor]]'''
* Changed texture of both the worn and item forms {{in|je}} to more closely match {{BE}}.

'''[[Spawn egg]]s'''
* Now sorted thematically in the [[Creative inventory]], according to the following categories:
** [[Overworld]]
*** Farm Animals
*** [[Mounts]]
*** [[Pets]]
*** Wild Animals
*** [[Aquatic]]
*** Miscellaneous
*** [[Golem]]s
*** [[Villager]]s
*** [[Undead]]
*** [[Spider]]s
*** [[Monster]]s
*** [[Illager]]s
** [[The Nether#Mobs|Nether]]
** [[The End#Mobs|The End]]
* [[File:Zombie Horse Spawn Egg JE3.png|32px|class=pixel-image]] Changed zombie horse spawn egg texture to reflect the [[zombie horse]]'s new texture.

=== Mobs ===
'''[[Horse]], [[donkey]], [[mule]], [[zombie horse]] and [[camel]]'''
* No longer sinks in water when ridden by a player.
** Riders are still dismounted if their head goes underwater.<ref name="head-underwater">{{cite bug|MC|303860|Riders are still dismounted from mounts when landing in water|resolution=Working as Intended}}</ref>

'''[[File:Piglin.png|32px]] [[Piglin]]'''
* Now considers the [[golden spear]] and [[golden nautilus armor]] as items it likes (for [[Piglin#Being_distracted|distraction]]).

'''[[Piglin]], [[zombie]], [[husk]] and [[zombified piglin]]'''
* Can now spawn holding a [[spear]] and use its charge attack.

'''[[File:Zombie Horse JE6.png|32px]] [[Zombie horse]]'''
* Updated texture.
* Now spawns naturally in [[plains]] and [[savanna]] biomes at night.
** Spawns being ridden by a [[zombie]] wielding an [[iron spear]], forming a [[zombie horseman]].
*** The zombie rider has a chance to drop a [[red mushroom]].
* Counts as a hostile mob while untamed, despawning like other hostile mobs.
* Now drops 2-3 [[rotten flesh]] instead of 1.
* Can now be tempted and healed using [[red mushroom]]s.
* Can now be equipped with a [[saddle]] and [[horse armor]].
* Now burns in [[sunlight]].
** Horse armor prevents the zombie horse from burning in sunlight.
